question.body: If we were to estimate the mean time with a 93% confidence interval, which of these could be that interval?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A 93% confidence interval must be wider than a 90% interval, but narrower than a 95% confidence interval. The interval you chose is wider than the 99% confidence interval (7.5, 8.5) and thus has a confidence level higher than 99%.

Incorrect. A 93% confidence interval must be wider than a 90% interval, but narrower than a 95% confidence interval. The interval you chose is wider than the 95% confidence interval (7.6, 8.4) and thus has a confidence level higher than 95%.
Correct. The 93% confidence interval should be wider than the 90% confidence interval (7.7, 8.3), but narrower than the 95% confidence interval (7.6, 8.4), and should be centered around 8.

Incorrect. Although the interval you chose is wider than the 90% confidence interval (7.7, 8.3) and narrower than the 95% confidence interval (7.6, 8.4), it is not centered around 8. Note that all of the original intervals are centered around 8, which is x-bar.

Incorrect. A 93% confidence interval must be wider than a 90% interval, but narrower than a 95% confidence interval. The interval you chose is narrower than the 90% confidence interval (7.7, 8.3) and thus has a confidence level lower than 90%.
